channel.title: BBC News - Technology

item.title: Apple defends new photo scanning child protection tech
item.description: The tech giant has insisted that its new technology will not be used to spy on its users.

item.title: Vodafone to bring back roaming charges from January
item.description: It follows EE's decision to reintroduce daily charges for using phone tariffs while in Europe

item.title: China sues Tencent over WeChat Youth Mode
item.description: Authorities allege the messaging app is violating Chinese law that aims to protect minors.

item.title: Ariana Grande sings in Fortnite's metaverse
item.description: The pop star is the latest musician to perform a series of concerts inside the hit video game.

item.title: Alibaba to sack manager accused of rape, according to memo seen by BBC
item.description: The move comes after a woman's allegations of sexual assault went viral on Chinese social media.

item.title: Groupon told to improve how it treats customers
item.description: The competition watchdog warns the discounter it faces legal action unless it takes 'swift' action.

item.title: Apple criticised for system that detects child abuse
item.description: There are privacy concerns that the system will be expanded to scan phones for political speech.

item.title: China cracks down on celebrity online culture
item.description: Weibo is to remove a list ranking celebrities by popularity on social media amid state criticism.

item.title: Huawei revenue sees biggest ever fall
item.description: Revenue from its consumer business, which includes phones, fell by nearly half.

item.title: Larry Page: Google co-founder granted New Zealand residency
item.description: The country's immigration services say he applied under a category for wealthy investors.

item.title: US consumer watchdog criticises Facebook's NYU ban claim
item.description: In a letter to Mark Zuckerberg, the FTC criticises the social network for inaccurate statements.

item.title: How smart buildings could transform our experience of work
item.description: Lara Lewington visits a new smart office block to see how technology could transform working lives.

item.title: CEO Secrets: Airbnb boss shares his business advice
item.description: Brian Chesky, co-founder and CEO of Airbnb, shares his business advice for the CEO Secrets series.

item.title: Untethered bi-pedal robot runs 5km and other tech news
item.description: Jen Copestake looks at some of the best technology news stories of the week.

item.title: Team BRITâ€™s Aaron Morgan: How hand controls help me race
item.description: The Team BRIT driver on how adapted cars help him compete in races against non-disabled drivers.

item.title: Vineyards set to go high tech with smart systems
item.description: Changing climate conditions and water shortages see some Australian wine growers turn to technology.

item.title: Why artificial intelligence is being used to write adverts
item.description: Advertisers are increasingly using artificial intelligence to come up with their winning slogans.

item.title: The perfect storm striking World of Warcraft
item.description: All of a sudden, WoW players are in revolt, and its competitors are having a boom.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: TikTok becomes the unofficial behind-the-scenes Olympic channel
item.description: The short-form video platform is giving fans unprecedented insight into the athletes' experience.

item.title: The fungus and bacteria tackling plastic waste
item.description: Bacteria, fungus and enzymes can all digest plastic, but can they work at a useful commercial scale?

item.title: Can better tech make video meetings less excruciating?
item.description: Technology firms are scrambling to add new features but will video calls improve.

item.title: Why remote working leaves us vulnerable to cyber-attacks
item.description: Experts warn working from home has led to complacency over security protocols
